summary: This is an FBI News Briefing dated August 11, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of the unsealing of documents in the legal battle between Alan Dershowitz and a Jeffrey Epstein accuser, Virginia Giuffre, within a section on criminal investigations. The document is primarily a news digest, not a case-specific legal document.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Harvard law professor involved in a legal battle with Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre; is seeking to subpoena and depose Les Wexner for evidence in his counter suit.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein accuser involved in a legal battle with Alan Dershowitz; Dershowitz alleges she tried to extort Les Wexner.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Former head of Victoria's Secret's parent company with ties to Jeffrey Epstein; Alan Dershowitz is seeking to subpoena and depose him for evidence in his counter suit against Giuffre.

persons.name: John Zeiger
persons.context: Attorney for Les Wexner; Alan Dershowitz is also asking that he be deposed and provide documents related to Wexner's relationship with Epstein accusers.

connections.description: Engaged in a legal battle; Dershowitz has filed a counter suit against Giuffre.
Dershowitz is seeking to subpoena and depose Wexner for evidence in his counter suit against Giuffre, alleging Giuffre tried to extort Wexner.
Zeiger is identified as Wexner's attorney.
Document references Wexner's ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Documents Unsealed in Dershowitz-Giuffre Legal Battle
events.description: New documents were unsealed in the legal battle between Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre and Harvard law professor Alan Dershowitz. The documents relate partly to Dershowitz's effort to subpoena and depose billionaire Les Wexner.

keyFacts: New documents were unsealed on August 10, 2020, in the ongoing legal battle between Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre and Alan Dershowitz.
The unsealed documents relate, in part, to Dershowitz's effort to subpoena and depose billionaire Les Wexner for evidence in his counter suit against Giuffre.
Dershowitz alleges that Giuffre tried to extort Les Wexner, who has known ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Dershowitz is also seeking to depose Wexner's attorney, John Zeiger, and obtain related documents.
This mention is a single item within a lengthy FBI news briefing covering hundreds of other unrelated national and international stories from August 11, 2020.
